description: Protecting every child from harmful and synthetic pesticides where they play and learn by banning glyphosate and other harmful and synthetic pesticides to support organic land management to your community.
cleaned_text: New Napa Movie](https://www.wine-searcher.com/m/2022/12/herbicide-the-star-of-new-napa-movie) Taylor Collins, Co-Founder of Force of Nature sits down with Kim Konte of Non-Toxic Neighborhoods along with other environmental leaders to discuss the highly toxic environments that cities perpetuate and what we can do to take action against it. [WHAT GOOD SHALL I DO - How to take action in an urban environment](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Z5sSSAu3JA) Taylor Collins, Co-Founder of Force of Nature sits down with Kim Konte of Non-Toxic Neighborhoods along with other environmental leaders to discuss the highly toxic environments that cities perpetuate and what we can do to take action against it. [PetPlace Chat: Philadelphia Councilwoman Cindy Bass Talks About the #PlayFree Initiative](https://www.petplace.com/article/dogs/just-for-fun/chat-philly-councilwoman-cindy-bass/) [Allentown, PA Launches Pesticide Free Playground Initiative](https://mms.tveyes.com/MediaCenterPlayer.aspx?u=aHR0cDovL21lZGlhY2VudGVyLnR2ZXllcy5jb20vZG93bmxvYWRnYXRld2F5LmFzcHg%2FVXNlcklEPTc3MDgxMiZNRElEPTE0ODY0MDM4Jk1EU2VlZD0zNTkmVHlwZT1NZWRpYQ%3D%3D) [Children's Environmental Bill of Rights - Model Law Launched](https://www.centerforenvironmentalrights.org/news/childrens-environmental-bill-of-rights-model-law-launched) In partnership with the [Center for Democratic and Environmental Rights](https://www.centerforenvironmentalrights.org/) (CDER), we have developed and now releasing a new model local ordinance, the Children's Environmental Bill of Rights. The model ordinance recognizes the right of children to clean air and water, to be free from synthetic pesticides and toxic chemicals, and to be healthy. [Protecting Every Child from Harmful and Synthetic Pesticides ](https://nontoxicneighborhoods.org/take-action-old-2/) Contribute today to make a difference in your community. OUR PROCESS EDUCATE Our advocacy is built on relationships, by supporting city staff, landscape contractors, and school administrators with the tools and training needed to successful end the use of synthetic pesticides. ACTIVATE We provide the training and resources needed to successfully transition to organic and regenerative management. 200 + Partner Cities You can help protect children today OUR CITIES To date, Non-Toxic Neighborhoods has partnered with over 200 + cities, counties, school districts and universities across the country to enormous success. We're proud to report that not a single partner community has resumed the use of synthetic pesticides! Make your city non-toxic.
